document_title: Streptococcal arthritis: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: viem-khop-lien-cau.json_6_Methods of treating arthritis caused by streptococcus
subsection_content:
Treatment regimen
Medical treatment: The disease is initially treated with empirical intravenous antibiotics. Then, depending on the results of bacterial culture, antibiogram (checking the level of drug resistance of bacteria), and disease progression, the duration of antibiotic use, as well as the type of amenorrhea, can be changed.; Arthroscopy, aspiration and drainage: In addition to antibiotic treatment, the doctor may prescribe drainage of joint pus, joint lavage, etc.; Surgical treatment: In cases of severe infection, damaged joints and bones, the doctor may consider prescribing bone removal surgery, placing biological cement, etc.
Some measures to combine treatment with antibiotics: Pain relief, fever reduction with paracetamol, anti-inflammatory combination when there are symptoms of severe pain and high fever. Provides adequate nutrition for the body as well as controls existing chronic diseases.
